name: AICTE Pragati Scholarship for Girls
eligibility: Girl students pursuing a technical degree/diploma. Family income should be less than Rs. 8 lakh per annum.

name: AICTE Saksham Scholarship Scheme
eligibility: Specially-abled students with 40% or more disability pursuing a technical degree/diploma. Family income less than Rs. 8 lakh p.a.

name: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for J&K
eligibility: Students of J&K pursuing general/professional/medical degree courses. Passed 10+2 from J&K board or CBSE schools in J&K. Family income less than Rs. 8 lakh p.a.
benefits: Up to Rs. 1.3 Lakh per annum

name: Merit-cum-Means Scholarship for Professional and Technical Courses
eligibility: Minority community students pursuing technical/professional courses. Secured at least 50% marks in the previous final examination. Family income not exceeding Rs. 2.5 lakh p.a.

name: Post-Matric Scholarship for Students with Disabilities
provider: Dept. of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities
eligibility: Students with 40% or more disability studying in class 11 to post-graduation. Family income less than Rs. 2.5 lakh p.a.
benefits: Maintenance allowance, book grants, and disability allowances

name: Central Sector Scheme of Scholarship for College and University Students
eligibility: Passed class 12th with above 80th percentile of successful candidates. Pursuing a regular course. Family income less than Rs. 4.5 lakh p.a.
benefits: Rs. 12,000 p.a. at Graduation; Rs. 20,000 p.a. at Post-Graduation.

name: Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme for Minorities
eligibility: Minority students studying from Class 11 to PhD. Secured at least 50% marks in the previous exam. Family income not more than Rs. 2 lakh p.a.
benefits: Admission and tuition fees, maintenance allowance.

name: Financial Assistance for Education of the Wards of Beedi/Cine/IOMC/LSDM Workers – Post-Matric
eligibility: Wards of Beedi, Cine, IOMC, LSDM workers studying in Class 11 to post-graduation. Passed the previous examination in the first attempt. Family income limits apply.

name: State Sector Post-Matric Scholarship for ST students, J&K
eligibility: ST students of Jammu and Kashmir pursuing post-matriculation courses. Family income must not exceed Rs. 2.5 lakh p.a.

name: J&K Post-Matric Scholarship for SC/OBC(EBC) Students
eligibility: SC/OBC(EBC) students of J&K pursuing post-matriculation courses. Family income limits apply.

name: Post-Matric Scholarship for Pahari Speaking People, J&K
eligibility: Pahari Speaking People (PSP) category students of J&K pursuing post-matriculation courses. Family income limits apply.

name: Pre-Matric Scholarship for ST Students, J&K
eligibility: ST students studying in classes 9 and 10. Family income must not exceed Rs. 2 lakh p.a.

name: J&K Pre-Matric Scholarship for SC/OBC(EBC)/PC/DNTs Students
eligibility: Students from SC/OBC(EBC)/PC/DNTs categories studying in classes up to 10th. Family income limits apply.

name: Begum Hazrat Mahal National Scholarship
eligibility: Meritorious girl students belonging to minority communities studying in Classes 9 to 12. Secured at least 50% marks in the previous exam. Family income not more than Rs. 2 lakh p.a.

name: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship
eligibility: Students of Class 9 who have secured at least 55% marks in the Class 8 examination. Family income must not exceed Rs. 3.5 lakh p.a.

name: Scholarship for Higher Education (SHE)
eligibility: Students in the top 1% of their 12th board exams, pursuing basic and natural sciences at BSc or Integrated MSc level.

name: Kishore Vaigyanik Protsahan Yojana (KVPY)
eligibility: Students of Class 11, 12 and first year UG in basic sciences. Must clear an aptitude test.
benefits: Monthly stipend up to Rs. 7,000 + contingency grant

name: HDFC Bank Educational Crisis Scholarship Support
eligibility: Students from Class 6 to PG facing a personal/family crisis that has impacted their education. Family income less than or equal to Rs. 3 lakh p.a.

name: Reliance Foundation Scholarships
eligibility: Meritorious students pursuing undergraduate and postgraduate degrees. Specific criteria for different fields.
benefits: Varies, covers tuition fees and other expenses

name: Tata Trusts Means-Grant for School
eligibility: Students from Class 8 onwards, based on financial need.

name: IndianOil Academics Scholarships
eligibility: Students pursuing 10+, ITI, Engineering, MBBS, and MBA courses. Based on merit and family income.
